title: High Arable Land Percentage
description: In 2022, 60.52% of Bangladesh's land area was arable, indicating a strong agricultural base.

title: Extensive Agricultural Irrigation
description: As of 2021, 78.90% of Bangladesh's agricultural land was irrigated, supporting robust crop production.

title: Dominance in Textiles and Clothing
description: In 2018, textiles and clothing accounted for 56.81% of the value added in Bangladesh's manufacturing sector.

title: High Manufactures Export Ratio
description: In 2015, 95.81% of Bangladesh's merchandise exports were manufactured goods, showcasing industrial strength.

title: Low Trade in Services Contribution
description: In 2023, trade in services contributed only 3.60% to Bangladesh's GDP, indicating a reliance on goods trade.

title: Minimal Domestic Health Expenditure
description: In 2022, domestic general government health expenditure was just 0.15% of GDP, highlighting limited public health investment.

title: Short Compulsory Education Duration
description: As of 2023, compulsory education in Bangladesh lasts only 5 years, which may impact long-term educational outcomes.

title: High Bound Rates on Products
description: In 2022, Bangladesh had a bound rate of 158.91% for all products and 179.79% for primary products, indicating high trade barriers.

title: Low Antiretroviral Therapy Coverage
description: In 2022, only 4% of pregnant women living with HIV received antiretroviral therapy, pointing to gaps in healthcare access.

title: Significant Poverty Impact from Health Costs
description: In 2016, 6.99% of Bangladesh's population was pushed below the $3.65 poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses.
